info.description: This is a set of simple tools for working with cuneiform numeric notations. Included are utilities for converting cuneiform numerals to Arabic notation, checking whether a string is parsable as a number, and querying the counted objects in a text.
info.title: CDLI Numeral Conversion

tags.name: convert
tags.description: Convert Sumerian numerals to Arabic notation:

tags.name: canparse
tags.description: Test whether a string can be parsed as a numeral:

tags.name: visualize
tags.description: API endpoints for use in vosualization:

tags.name: commodify
tags.description: Find counted objects in a text:

post.summary: Given a word, lists the number systems with which that word is counted.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

query.description: The word to get information about.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: A list of number systems which can be used to count this item.

post.summary: Given a word, returns a collection of statistics describing the distribution of counts associated with that word.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: The number system to describe. Counts which are not written in this system will be excluded when computing the statistics.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description:
A collection of statistics describing the distribution of counts associated with this item. 
  - n-instances: number of entries which record this item
  - sum: sum of all counts recording this item 
  - sum-unit: unit used to compute the sum
  - mean: mean of counts used with this item
  - variance: variance of counts used with this item
  - stdev: standard deviation of counts used with this item
  - skewness: skewness of counts used with this item
  - kurtosis: kurtosis of counts used with this item
  - gmean: geometric mean of counts used with this item
  - hmean: harmonic mean of counts used with this item
  - median: median of counts used with this item
  - mode: most common count used with this item

post.summary: Returns a list of all the commodities found ins the specified corpus, and a dictionary of meanings for those words.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: An object containing a list of words found in the corpus and a dictionary of definitions for those words.

post.summary: Given a word, returns a list of commodities which can occur in the same tablet as that word.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: Limit results to entries that use the specified number system.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: An array of objects listing the words which occur in tablets alongside the query term, and how often they occur together.

post.summary: Given a word, returns a graph of all adjectives and other modifiers used to describe that word.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: Limit results to entries that use the specified number system.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: A graph where nodes represent modifier words and edges record how often a pair of modifiers are used together.

post.summary: Given a word, returns a graph of all commodities which can occur in the same tablet as that word.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: Limit results to entries that use the specified number system.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: A graph where nodes represent commodities and edges record how often a pair of commodities occur in a tablet together.

post.summary: Given a word and a number system, returns a list of all numbers used to count that word, as evaluated using the specified system. If the object is counted with more than one number system, counts which can't be interpreted using the chosen system will be ignored.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: The number system to use when evaluating the numerals.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: An array containing the value of every number used to count the query object.

post.summary: Given a word and a number system, returns a list of all lines in the corpus which contain the specified word counted using the specified number system.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: The number system to use for filtering the results.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: An array listing lines which contain the input word counted using the specified system. Each line is accompanied by the value, in modern notation, of the associated count, and the number of times that line occurs in the corpus.

post.summary: Given a word, returns a list of all adjectives and other descriptors used to modify the counted object. Results are limited to lines which use a user-specified number system.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: The number system to use for filtering the results.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get or process data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: An array listing adjectives and other descriptors which modify the search term, alongside a count specifying how many times this descriptor occurs with the search term.

post.summary: Given a word, returns a list of similar words and a summary of how these words' distributions differ from the distribution of the input word.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

system.description: The number system to use for filtering the results.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: An array listing words with similar distributions to the search term. The five most similar terms are returned in order of decreasing similarity.

divergence.description: KL divergence between this term\'s distribution and the search term\'s distribution

distribution.description: Array describing a simple histogram of this item\'s distribution, limited to the domain of the search term\'s histogram for ease of comparison.

value.description: Percent of counts which occur in this bin.

label.description: Human-readable label for this bar of the histogram.

bin.description: Human-readable label showing the range this bin encompasses.

delta.description: Array describing how this item\'s distribution differs from that of the search term, limited to the domain of the search term\'s histogram for ease of comparison.

value.description: Difference between the number of counts which occur in this bin and the number of counts which occured in this bin for the search term. Expressed as a percentage.

label.description: Human-readable label for this bar of the histogram.

bin.description: Human-readable label showing the range this bin encompasses.

post.summary: Convert a Sumerian numeral to Arabic notation

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

language.description: The language the number comes from. Current version only supports Sumerian.

system.description: The number system to use for conversion. If none is supplied, a list of all possible conversions is returned.

200.description: Converted successfully. Returns a list of possible readings:

400.description: Missing or invalid parameter, or request is not of type application/json.

post.summary: Determine whether a string can be parsed as a numeral

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object:

language.description: The language the number comes from. Current version only supports Sumerian.

greedy.description: Specifies whether to greedily parse missing signs. If true, broken and missing signs will be ignored, so e.g. '1(u) ... sze' will be considered a valid number.

200.description: Converted successfully. Returns a list of systems that can parse the query string:

400.description: Missing or invalid parameter, or request is not of type application/json.

post.summary: Get or generate commodity information about a group of texts. Data is loaded from a file if one exists; else the API fetches ATF from the CDLI database, processes the text, and returns the processed data.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Request body should be a JSON object.

corpus.description: Representation of the corpus to get or process data from. Can be a space or comma-delimited list of P-numbers, or an encoded representation of such a list. See site/assets/js/urlparams.js for details about how to perform the encoding.

200.description: Returns a list with one item per input text. Each entry summarizes the numeric and commodity data of the corresponding text.

400.description: Missing or invalid parameter, or request is not of type application/json.

system.description: Name of a number system which is used with the query term.

number.description: The number of times this number is used to count the parent commodity.

commodity.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("number" in the schema) is a number in Sumerian notation.

counts_by_commodity.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("commodity" in the schema) is an object from all_objects.

number.description: The number of times this number is used to count the parent commodity.

commodity.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("number" in the schema) is a number in Sumerian notation.

counts_by_modified_commodity.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("commodity" in the schema) is a string of objects and descriptors.

commodity.description: Array listing all possible readings of all the numbers used to count this item.

values_by_commodity.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("commodity" in the schema) is an object from all_objects.

commodity.description: Array listing all possible readings of all the numbers used to count this item.

values_by_modified_commodity.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("commodity" in the schema) is a string of objects and descriptors.

pair.description: Counts how many times a pair of words co-occur in this text. (Each pair is counted separately, so a text with two instances of A and two of B will have 4 instances of the pair A-B)

collocation_counts.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("pair" in the schema) is a pair of words from all_objects.

all_objects.description: Array of all the counted objects in this text.

line.description: Counts how many times this line occurs.

line_counts.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("line" in the schema) is a line from the text.

line.description: List of texts that contain this line.

line_sources.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("line" in the schema) is a line from the text.

counted.description: Array listing all counted objects in this line.

value.description: Array listing the possible readings for the numbers in this line.

modifiers.description: Array listing all of the adjectives and other modifiers that apply to the counted objects in this line.

line_data.description: Keys are dynamic. Each key ("line" in the schema) is a line from the text.

cdli_no.description: The P-number associated with this text.

dictionary.description: Each key is a word found in all_objects. Values are arrays of string definitions.
